title: 91/18/EEC: Commission Decision of 19 December 1990 authorizing certain Member States to apply intra- Community surveillance to imports originating in third countries which have been put into free circulation in the Community and which may be the subject of protective measures under Article 115 of the Treaty (only the Spanish, Danish, English, French, Italian and Portuguese texts are authentic)
header:
COMMISSION DECISION  of 19 December 1990  authorizing certain Member States to apply intra-Community surveillance to imports originating in third countries which have been put into free circulation in the Community and which may be the subject of  protective measures under Article 115 of the Treaty  (Only the Spanish, Danish, English, French, Italian and Portuguese texts are authentic)  (91/18/EEC)
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body:
Article 1
The Member States named in the annex are authorized, insofar as each is concerned, to apply, until 31 December 1991 and in accordance with Decision 87/433/EEC, intra-Community surveillance of the products listed in the said Annex.   Article 2
This Decision is addressed to the Kingdom of Denmark, the Kingdom of Spain, the French Republic, Ireland, the Italian Republic, the Portuguese Republic, the United Kingdom.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 19 December 1990.
For the Commission
Frans ANDRIESSEN
Vice-President   (1) OJ No L 238, 21. 8. 1987, p. 26. (2)
Decision C (89) 2303 final.
